content.mainText: Get out a medium size mixing bowl.
Add 3 tablespoons of melted butter. Add 2 eggs. Whisk.

tips.title: I hate whisking.
tips.text: You can use a food processor too. Just let the batter rest longer in later steps.

content.mainText: Add 1 tablespoon of sugar. Add 1/2 teaspoon vanilla. Whisk.

tips.title: What kind of sugar?
tips.text: We used white, but brown is cool too.

tips.title: I still hate whisking.
tips.text: You better stop making crepes then.

content.mainText: Add 1 cup of milk. Add 1/2 a cup of water. Whisk.

tips.title: I like thicker crepes.
tips.text: Using less milk (around 2/3 of a cup) will make them more pancake-y.

tips.title: What kind of milk do you use?
tips.text: I typically use 1%, but some people like 2%. I'm sure double-blind trials would indicate you don't have a preference.

tips.title: I loathe whisking now.
tips.text: I take it the servants are on vacation today?

content.mainText: Set a small frying pan on medium heat. Add a little butter.
Let the batter sit for 15 at room temp.
Pour 1/2 a cup of batter into the pan. Tilt the pan to spread it out. When it's browning on one side, flip it.
Once cooked on both sides, remove it and put it on a plate. Do this over and over for the rest of the batter.
Set plates and cutlery. Serve with stuff to go with the crepes.
